page.title: 06Recreation&Community Centre
page.content: The Dilhorne Recreation and Community Centre is somewhat unusual in that it is totally voluntary unaided Centre run by a small management committee of approximately 12, established in 1969 by a Scheme of the Secrtetary of State for Education & Science(under the Charities Act of 1960). It stands in quite a historical setting being on the site of the old Dilhorne Hall. The original hall was demolished in 1350, to be replaced twice, the last one in 1837, this was demolished in 1927 and all that remains is the Dilhorne Lodge at the entrance to the Centre.This requires finance and attention to bring it back into use. It is a Grade 2 listed building. There is an ice-house of rare character within the grounds, which extends to approximately 4.5 acres.
